content.webTitle: Review: You Don't Mess With the Zohan

fields.headline: You Don't Mess With the Zohan
fields.bodyText: Adam Sandler plays Zohan, hero of the Israeli army and top man on the Tel Aviv beach, who grows weary of his celebrity, fakes his death and escapes to New York to work as a hairdresser. He's pursued there by his arch enemy, a Palestinian terrorist called the Phantom (John Turturro). Zohan looks and sounds like a character created by Sacha Baron Cohen and pursues the same line in social embarrassment and misogynistic sex jokes. But his aim is didactic rather than disruptive. Sadly, his attempts to bring about mutual understanding between Jews and Palestinians are crude and sentimental.
